column4: I am upgrading my server (has gui) and halfway through the process I put the terminal window down... I have no taskbar though and alt-tab is not working since I started the upgrade... HELP
not really because I need THAT terminal window where it is halfway thru the process...
Ummm, use the other terminal to create a new gnome panel, then add the window switcher to the gnome panel
I can right-click and get many of the xfce options still... can I get it back that way?
although when I click on panel manager nothing happens
Oh, you're on xfce.  I'm not that familiar with it but the same trick should work, create a new xfce panel, add a window switcher
alt + tab, AND super + tab don't work?  You could go to the keyboard shortcut settings in xfce and turn them back on.
there is nothing under keyboard shortcuts, I will have to add them. What is the name of program that switches windows again?
There isn't a program that switches your windows.  It's a feature in your window manager.
Apparently in your case that's xfce
MIDDLE CLICK FTW! thank you so much that worked
I think you might be SOL.  If you don't have any software to manage your windows then you can't very well expect to be able to.
You need to install an add-on for that I think.
